website_summaries.verdict: A simple cue rack strong enough to hold billiard equipment and accessories.
pros: Rack is made of durable, high-quality wood with attractive mahogany finish
Designed to hold cues, balls, and triangle
Offers a professional look for an affordable price
cons: Bottom rack is not mounted to wall, so it tends to pull out when a pool cue is removed
Lack of instructions makes assembly difficult

customer_reviews.title: I'm underwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: For $40 I didn't expect hand-carved mahogany but I thought I'd at least get something that would do the job. This rack is cheap. It's cheap wood that goes together weakly using cheap hardware. And the mounting design and hardware are a joke. This rack would still be overpriced at $15.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this one
customer_reviews.text: This wall rack is hung on two picture hanger loops, only at the top of the frame. It doesn’t equip with the nessaary hardware to secure it at the bottom. It’s way too easy to pull the rack off the wall when you are removing the cue sticks. I should have paid more attention to those negative reviews before buying this item. Now I have to repair and repaint my drywall. It is such a frustrating experience. Will not recommend. Buyer be aware!
customer_reviews.author: BNM

customer_reviews.title: If you are even slightly handy, you can overcome the flaws.  Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I see why others have not reviewed this product well. They need to include a bracket for the bottom and not just a simple hanger. It's not designed to "mount" to the wall. It's designed to "hang" on the wall. But I mounted it anyways and put a screw behind the hole where the triangle hangles and put a small bracket on the bottom (out of eyesight when you are standing). Looks great, holds my cues and balls and chalk and I haven't had a problem. It's been up almost two months now.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G.Top Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Great after a quick and easy design flaw fix. PLEASE READ BEFORE DECIDING NOT TO BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I was almost turned away due to some of the negative reviews on here in regards to quality. I must say, the quality of the wood is excellent. However, it is true what there are some flaws to the design. DO NOT USE more than 4 lbs torque on a driver to drive the screws and you'll be fine. Also, I purchased an L shaped bracket at the hardware store in order to mount from bottom (see photo attached) and make it stable when removing pool sticks. Really easy fix and works great. If it wasn't because of this design flaw that I had to fix I'd give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Osmany Benitez

customer_reviews.title: feel cheap poor quality
customer_reviews.text: stay away if you are looking for quality one..this is just a simple one
customer_reviews.author: eli c.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality .... Damages pool sticks
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made, will damage all your pool sticks. Do not buy....
customer_reviews.author: FRED

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy as a gift. The rack looks ok, but it's not meant to last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: Ehh, looks nice, very simple, not worth the price tag though! Get the 8 cue stick stand, far better quality and bang for the buck! The product(s) arrived on time, as described by Amazon & manufacturer, it was shipped without issue, arrived within prescribed estimates, the packaging was undamaged, and the product itself was unmolested and made with quality materials. Description, photograph, website presentation, and what arrived are the same-size, shape, color, and it matched my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: 007Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Hanging this is probably a 2 man job just so someone can hold one end while the other person mounts the other end. And make sure you aren't hanging it too high. I think we have 3 inches from the ceiling (with the stick on it). It looks nice on the wall and is doing its job. We only have 2 sticks but we also put a bridge in one of the slots. Hubby doesn't like to put the balls on it (weird, I know) so we use one of those shelves for the table brush.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja Jones

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Okay quality, you truly do get what you pay for. Despite the not step-by-step instructions, we were able to assemble it just fine. We needed to use our electric drill to screw the screws in since the holes weren't pre-drilled, but it resulted in a pretty solid assembly. 4 stars because it does sit crookedly on the wall. Fixed with some adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: A. Price

customer_reviews.title: Find something better quality
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked it a lot more if it was $15. Cheap and overpriced. The cue holders came attached and they're not even straight. I already put it together so I'm just keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Move on
customer_reviews.text: Move on to the next listing Cheaply constructed no instructions and no hanging hardware included in packaging. Still sitting in our garage !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pictures to follow for a solid easy assembly, no batteries required!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love the Mahogany finish, the rack was simple to assemble, all the screws and brackets were in a nice bag, everything was packed perfectly with the diagram for inventory and assembling; the wood is solid, and it looks good on the wall! We are very pleased with this purchase. Thank you again!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Harris

customer_reviews.title: this works great and is sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: For $30 plus shipping...this works great and is sturdy enough. When installing, I recommend starting with the two middle horizontal bars (that hold the balls) and attach them to the two vertical bars. Start by screwing them in half way and proceed to attach the other pieces. Then screw them all in when satisfied with the outcome. This makes it easier to make sure everything is lined up correctly. Instead of the 2 drywall screw inserts they provided for mounting, I used my own (better ones). I also added small L-brackets under the bottom piece to secure the bottom to the wall. Overall im happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Entreri

customer_reviews.title: Visible Mounting Brackets Ruin It
customer_reviews.text: - The top mounting brackets aren’t hidden, so you can see the screws holding it up. They don’t show this on the pictures of the product, which feels really deceptive. - No bottom support, so it pulls from the wall when you try put in / pull out cues. - It doesn’t fit our (what I thought was standard) 8 ball rack, which is so frustrating! It looks decent but ultimately super disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: The two horizontal pieces are flush to the wall. But the two vertical pieces are not notched deep enough to allow them to fit flush against the wall where they attach to the top horizontal piece. I doubt its designed to be angled away from the wall and noticed someone even asked about it in the question section. Also there are a few blemishes in the finish. Poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Pam V.

customer_reviews.title: Pass this up
customer_reviews.text: t looks nice but its not very sturdy. It doesn't come with any instruction to put it together but it was pretty easy to guess. However, the mounting really sucks. Its just a picture hook so its not sturdy on the wall at all, you have to push it against the wall when you pull off a stick so you can get them off. I had to rig up a new way to mount it to make it a little more sturdy. Also the display picture is not accurate. As other people stated, the spacing is way off. The ball rack overlaps with the balls.
customer_reviews.author: KatelynTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: Apparently there was a previous issue with the set up not coming with two chair brackets for the bottom....this was not the case with my order and it came with everything needed for it to work perfectly. It looks smart and stays secure to the wall when removing the pool cues.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney L Gostkowski

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, but mount with care
customer_reviews.text: This is a good looking pool cue holder. It is very much as advertised. Mine didn't have instructions, but it is fairly intuitive if you are handy. The mounting on the wall is somewhat iffy, in that this is something that will get a fair amount of pulling and if it isn't mounted in a stud and is just in drywall it will definitely be ripped off the wall. I suggest trying to mount in a stud to make sure your's doesn't come off the wall quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G. L.

customer_reviews.title: Look like it cost way more
customer_reviews.text: It is like others have said, a little wobbly. With the right reinforcement this thing is awesome. Great space saver and looks really nice. I was skeptical the entire way too.
customer_reviews.author: P. Burchfield

customer_reviews.title: TERRIFIC piece for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together (I really recommend an electric screwdriver, though), decent enough finish and a convenient addition to my game room. One caveat: I'm not crazy about the wall fastening system; you'll need to add an "L" bracket or two underneath to keep the rack steady enough to yank cue sticks out without also yanking the thing off the wall. It's an easy fix for a small design flaw. At this price, however, it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Motsie

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived missing all hardware and the rack dowel for hanging the rack. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: shappens

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: Whoever designed this did not pay attention to much detail. Look at the photos, the boards do not even fit into the cut out areas. Also, no where is it mentioned but this will not lay flush against a wall because the cut outs are not accurate. It will always be off and leaning at an angle. The wood seemed very cheap and flimsy, so I returned this entire unit.
customer_reviews.author: parcar

customer_reviews.title: Your 8-Ball Rack might not fit!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, great rack. I went ahead and ran a screw threw the top part of the frame and drove it into a stud in the wall instead of using the drywall ancors. But the main thing that made me just a little upset was that my standard 8-ball rack does not fit between the two uprights. Use my photos as a guide to see if yours fits. The opening is just shy of 13.75 inches wide.
customer_reviews.author: Red, Oklahoma City

customer_reviews.title: Looks good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Looks really good for the price. I didn't use those picture hangers that was attached to the top piece because it didn't look good. Instead I use a long dry wall screw and drill it in between cue stick clip (2nd picture)
customer_reviews.author: Naga Speed

customer_reviews.title: Be careful the real size
customer_reviews.text: Quality was okay but the height was very low. I mean the distance between 2 bars was narrow. The AD picture misleading most of the buyers as I believe.
customer_reviews.author: DB3406

customer_reviews.title: Simple and efficient
customer_reviews.text: it is simple and very nice. I like that it holds cues, balls and triangle. We have a multi-purpose game table with a pool table/air hockey combo so this is perfect for holding the equipment when not in use. The other review are correct about having to secure the bottom to make sure the rack doesn't pull away from the wall if someone simply tries to pull a cue out of the rack
customer_reviews.author: Amy S

customer_reviews.title: It's Ok
customer_reviews.text: The product was ok, but it didn't come with any screws or instructions. I used some drywall screws to put it together and it went together well. I just need to find something to hang the triangle on. I'm sure it was a mistake leaving the screws out, and I would buy another one if I need
customer_reviews.author: James LaBarbera

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my dad to go with his game room pool table, dart board, slot machine, and more he really Likes this addition to his Man Cave lol and we were happy to supply him with such a great gift it looks great on the wall perfect addition
customer_reviews.author: Blessed Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Holds everything nice and neat
customer_reviews.text: Love it..holds everything...cues, balls, and rack neatly organized. Really easy to put together. The cues snap easy into it when die playing. Definitely recommend Love
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Labonte

customer_reviews.title: Questionable.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I’m too keen on the mounting, but it seems to be holding up. The clips are the next thing I’m concerned about because they attach in the lower and thicker end of the cues. We’ll see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: B.D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect holder
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our game room. Easy to install and looks good on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: christine kennedy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BILLIARD CUES AND MOUNT
customer_reviews.text: As a female I assembled it myself, nailed it to the wall near the billiard table and it looks so professional. Such a fun project. Affordable, too.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Masters McCart

customer_reviews.title: Cue Sticks & Billiards Ball Rack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Billiards rack for my dad’s new cue sticks and balls. He hadn’t assembled it yet but, the other reviews were really good so I’m hopeful that it will go together nicely for him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the billiard room holds extra balls, cue sticks, the triangle and room for chalk
customer_reviews.author: Tina clay

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and so far has held up great to constant use by teenagers! Looks nice on our game room wall and keeps our billiard accessories neatly organized and accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy's Girl

customer_reviews.title: Product ok but picture of product is deceiving
customer_reviews.text: Picture is deceiving since the product doesn’t come with six cue stick and doesn’t come with 9 ball rack. Would be nice to have picture corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Niru

customer_reviews.title: Seriously?
customer_reviews.text: Cheap wood, cut outs are rounded but the boards are squared. Looks horrible. NOT worth the $40+
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy H

customer_reviews.title: it seemed pretty solid and it'll work for what we need
customer_reviews.text: Pieces didn't always line up (when assembling) so you have to play with it a little to get it to fit it together and the pieces colors vary a little (not an identical match). However once it was together, it seemed pretty solid and it'll work for what we need!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Callahan

customer_reviews.title: not well designed. Does not hold cue ball, ...
customer_reviews.text: not well designed. Does not hold cue ball, however, the biggest issue is how this is mounted...no stability at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Most hardware missing
customer_reviews.text: I had to go out and buy the missing hardware - totally negated any savings on this product versus buying new.
customer_reviews.author: Zen4Tina

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Unlike what it shows in the picture, this rack is not wide enough to hang a standard triangle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Red

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: One of the cross members didn’t fit snuggly so I had to alter the part to fit properly. It’s not the heavy wood, sturdy bracket I had hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Fred McMellon

customer_reviews.title: Damaged prior to receiving
customer_reviews.text: Item came with scratches on it. For the price I am very disappointed in the condition it arrived in. I would not buy this item!
customer_reviews.author: BPeake

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty nice wall rack for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty nice wall rack for the price. I have it mounted outside with my table under a covered patio so over time, it could warp. I wouldn't recommend that, but out of the box, very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Kobashigawa

customer_reviews.title: Nice design
customer_reviews.text: This rack is sleek and functional. Looks very nice and professional plus holds up to 8 cues!
customer_reviews.author: erin redfield

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. They don't send the hardware so you have to use their diagram to buy it. I did so and followed their screw sizing exactly. Went to put together last night and the wood all cracked. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good rack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. Was packaged nicely. Easy to assemble. Unlike other reviews the one I received was correctly proportional like the picture. It also included matching brackets to mount the bottom to the wall. They were in a separate package with separate instructions. I’m assuming this was added later because of the complaints.
customer_reviews.author: C1truz

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!!
customer_reviews.text: I got wonderful item for Christmas! All mounting hardware was great! The instructions were easy to follow! No probles! Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Daddy Bear

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our pool room and followed the suggestion previous reviewers posted. Using 2 small L brackets, we secured it to the wall and have had no problems. It holds everything we need securely and neatly. It is not a big, sturdy 2x4 wooden structure but for our needs and the price it was a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Booknut

customer_reviews.title: Its great for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is decent for the price. I added some washers on the top nails so it won't pull out and added an L bracket at the bottom and it stays in place when i pull the sticks. Its great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: George Arce

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: The shelves are spaced wrong and not like the picture. It also does not connect to the wall in a functional way. It only has two picture hangers on the top so it falls off every time you grab a stick - or breathe on it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, only thing that others have stated before ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, only thing that others have stated before me is that you need stabiltiy on bottom of rack. Secure that and it's all good
customer_reviews.author: steve c

customer_reviews.title: Awesome design
customer_reviews.text: Solid design. Even came with extra hardware to properly mount top to wall, and l brackets to secure base to wall. I get a ton of compliments!
customer_reviews.author: Copper lover

customer_reviews.title: Great size for a few cues
customer_reviews.text: This rack is easy to put together. The cons are that it hangs by 2 small hooks at the top so you need to hold the rack when taking the cue sticks in and out. The pros are that it is just the right size for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Zipps

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Looks fabulous in my poolroom– man cave. Sturdy and made of real wood.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bryant Neville, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Nice wall rack. Assembly was easy and does a good job storing my pool table accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Collrin

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice, but my husband had to make some adjustments and add some things to the back to make it attach flush against the wall. We are satisfied with it and it looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: 2lazylabs

customer_reviews.title: Looks good on my wall
customer_reviews.text: I heeded some other reviews and bought extra bracers. Looks good on my wall! The only thing is the way it's put together, the top and bottom part are not flushed against the wall, one is slightly jutting out but I'll live.
customer_reviews.author: EvanS

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Good buy, you will need to attach extra brackets at bottom to keep it from pulling away and hitting the wall when removing sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Snshyne4u2c

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to put together. Looks great on the wall and it hold everything I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: KrisKrisKris

customer_reviews.title: Best deal
customer_reviews.text: Best deal has held up over here"use it often and I have kids and friends with kids go ahead buy you won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: missing top clip on right side for sticks and THIS IS NOT OAK FINISH. very disappointed and after reading the other reviews, this should be -5 stars. In the pic you can tell the difference between real oak finish on the wood trim and the "Oak" on rack. looks like Mahogany to me and that is not what I ordered
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Tharp

customer_reviews.title: The item was delivered in condition promised.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift which was easily installed by my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: James McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty well made product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty well made product. Simple to put together. Took about 30 minutes to assemble, taking my time. I also chose to use 3M command strips to hang it on the wall instead or using the included mounting hardware. I did this to avoid putting holes in my wall.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little cue rack
customer_reviews.text: Sweet little cue rack, I bought it for a friend as a house warming gift and he loved it. It was easy to assemble, and looks great. I wish it had an additional spot for the white ball, everything else fits on it good.
customer_reviews.author: matt ellenberger

customer_reviews.title: Very stylish in our pool table ara
customer_reviews.text: This product looks really cool on the wall. I had a solid wood, homemade one but it wasn't sleek enough for my decor. This new one is lightweight and has nice quality hardware on it. It was very easy to assemble and hang
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Carolan

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Exactly as pictured. Very happy with it. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Momma

customer_reviews.title: NICE
customer_reviews.text: hubby loves it and it looks really nice on the wall
customer_reviews.author: lmb333

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship on ball channels!
customer_reviews.text: My biggest complaint is that the channels for the balls are too long. Your pool balls will not sit nice and tight as in the pictures but will rest sloppily with about an extra inch and a half of space scattered between them. I guess the manufacturer didn't think to measure. And you'll have to come up with some brackets on the bottom to stabilize the rack if you intend on actually pulling the cues out of the holders or you'll tear the thing from the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Black

customer_reviews.title: Cue racl
customer_reviews.text: Installed the cue rack and got some good comments from the relatives.
customer_reviews.author: John Mande

customer_reviews.title: Some assembly required but solid product
customer_reviews.text: Good price. You do have to assemble and there no instructions. I assembled a few pieces inaccurately so had to take apart and start again, but only took a minute. It holds our gear and is very solid. Happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Diane Chin

customer_reviews.title: Scratched out of the box - repaired poorly in another.
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived 2 scratched areas on one side board and with a sloppy repaired mar on the other. I contacted Iszy Billiards and was told that this was purchased direct from Amazon. I'm finishing a game room for a rental property and the first guests come in Friday, No time to reorder and get it this weekend. Very disappointed. By the way, the scratched part near the screw was scratched when we got it, It did not happend while putting the screws in,
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: We like it
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to replace the rack we had and it is very nice - better than the one we had. The cue sticks shown in the graphic are a bit on the short side - ours extend quite a bit above the top bracket. That is not a problem for us, but you may want to know that if it would be an issue for you. Overall, very happy with this rack.
customer_reviews.author: C.Shelton

customer_reviews.title: but pretty poor show
customer_reviews.text: Came with no hardware .... no screws ... no dowel ... nothing ... I had some extra screws so did not bother to return, but pretty poor show. The rack is OK but would not recommend or buy again. .... You can do better than this Amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mosey

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our pool room!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this rack when we purchased our new pool table. It was easy to assemble and seems sturdy enough to do the job. I just wish that it had room to hold 8 cues instead of 6.
customer_reviews.author: Markie Gooch

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The rack was easy to assemble and mount. It holds everything well and it’s really sturdy. Looks great on my wall.
customer_reviews.author: Liza

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Everything came as expected and in a timely matter.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P Mullin Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: rack itself was functional but received it with a chip on one of the shelves.
customer_reviews.author: Eliana Rascon

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah uhm I got a pool cue holder but not the one I ordered. They didn’t even manage to get the color right.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Rocheleau

customer_reviews.title: The directions could be better. I am sure everyone to put this thing ...
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and most seemed positive so purchased the cue holder. The directions could be better. I am sure everyone to put this thing together at least twice. It's made of real wood which is a bonus although hanging it to the wall is somewhat confusing
customer_reviews.author: Jay Deming

customer_reviews.title: Wall rack is good value for price
customer_reviews.text: Wall rack is good value for price. However, inability to fit a full set of snooker balls on the rack precludes providing higher rating. When ordering, presumed set of either pool or snooker balls would fit on rack. Unfortunately, an additional shelf or wider rack would be required to accommodate snooker set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not sit flush against the wall.
customer_reviews.text: The rank does not fit flush against the wall. The top section pushed the rack out about 1/2 inch but the bottom of the rack is flush. This causes it to stick away from the way at the top and not at the bottom. Poor design in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but does the trick,
customer_reviews.text: After receiving my first one, I reorder another one for return because the cue stick butt cit outs did not align with the top stick clamps. The second one was no better. For the price it will work and as a wall mount it saves space,
customer_reviews.author: SureShot

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this when we moved into our new home and it looks great. I am really pleased with the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Asif

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice piece. My only gripe would be that it is designed to hold only 15 balls, there is no storage slot for the cue ball.
customer_reviews.author: scally

customer_reviews.title: Minnesota Fats would be proud
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and hang on the wall. It looks great when it’s finished
customer_reviews.author: TN John

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy wall unit. Looks just like picture. Wishing there was just a little more shelf space got rule book.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Almost, but not there yet
customer_reviews.text: It works for our needs, but Very flimsy. We ultimately decided to hang it on the wall and support it in other places to keep the unit usable. Maybe do 2 hangers on the back (one on each side) rather than one in the middle. Pool Sticks are sufficient for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: MrsK1611

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what it says. Decent durability and it holds ask the things for billiards
customer_reviews.author: D. Hardin

customer_reviews.title: and directions would be nice, but once you lay all the prices out ...
customer_reviews.text: Little tight for the holders when you have wide pool cues... and directions would be nice, but once you lay all the prices out with the picture offline it is self explanatory. Works for what I need!
customer_reviews.author: Tamrin Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This keeps all our billiards equipment nice and tidy! There is a place for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Rita G.

customer_reviews.title: Love the look. Nice having on the wall.
customer_reviews.text: Nice organizer. Got my cues off the floor leaning against the wall. Looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Old School Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Seriously????
customer_reviews.text: This is honestly horrific. The assembly instructions are minimalist. Almost no information. There are screws here that aren’t even mentioned. The parts don’t even fit correctly. Like for real?? There is no instruction on how to mount this mf-ing thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: John's Pool Cue Rack Review
customer_reviews.text: I am generally pleased with this product. It arrived undamaged, was easy to assemble and has a good appearance once assembled. The only criticism is the method of mounting on the wall. It hangs by only 2 triangular wire loops, which is somewhat flimsy considering that the rack is quite heavy after the cues, balls, and other accessories are stored on it. I felt that additional reinforcement by means of wall anchors was necessary to properly secure the rack to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: John Edward Larson

customer_reviews.title: Very pricey. .save your money
customer_reviews.text: Quality was ok very pricey for what you get looks like it was built in a shop class at school. Would not recommend this unless you're going for the cheap look in your game room. .delivery was fast and on time
customer_reviews.author: Faz..

customer_reviews.title: Looked great.  Nice lush color.  Can't wait to hang it up!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because of all of the negative reviews but was very pleased when I got it all put together. I agree with some, I'm not to sure about the hooks to secure it to the wall, but that can be easily remedied with a quick trip to the hardware store. It's very nice looking and sturdy. Very pleased with it. Can't wait to give it to my boyfriend for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice Billiard set.
customer_reviews.text: Nice set. May want to anchor the bottom of the rack. It tends to flop a little when removing the cues. Cues sticks are decent quality. Tips need to be tapered. So you may want to order a tip tool as well other wise the tips are flat and it's harder to aim.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: now useless but no way to complete and use the shelves
customer_reviews.text: can someone contact me about this product? the 2 uprights which should be a left and a right, came in with 2 rights...... now useless but no way to complete and use the shelves....
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Conspec Bermuda

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: looks great. Looks more solid than it actually is. Mine had a crack down the back of one of the wood prices. Since it was on the back and didn't affect the functionality or look, I didn't care. You get what you pay for, but overall I am happy. Looks great.
customer_reviews.author: P Flann

product_meta.title: Cue Rack Only - 6 Pool Cue - Billiard Stick Wall Rack Made of Wood Choose Mahogany, Black or Oak Finish
product_meta.description:
